#xwiki 15:15  has joined #xwiki 15:15  hi all 15:16  I've a little issue regarding right management on XWiki 15:16  I don't have any group named "Unregistered Users" (as said in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement) 15:16  has joined #xwiki 15:17  So, if I restrict edition to a given group, unregistered users did not even see the page anymore 15:17  has quit 15:17  any ideas ? 15:17 <+tmortagne> sauthieg: it's not really a groups actually 15:17 <+tmortagne> \*group 15:17 <+tmortagne> it's a special user 15:18  has joined #xwiki 15:18  I don't see it either in Group or User listings in the rights page 15:18  has joined #xwiki 15:19 <+tmortagne> switch to "Users" 15:19 <+tmortagne> in rights 15:19 <+tmortagne> and you will find it at the top of the table 15:20 <+tmortagne> before even the filter 15:20  I have Admin as first entry when selecting Users instead of Groups 15:20  Ok got it 15:20  hi 15:21  i did some browsing of the annotation code (using xwiki eclips 15:21  e 15:21  Yeah, it works 15:21  Thanks tmortagne 15:21  (i am trying to enhance the code so that annotations with more than one color can be done) 15:21 <+tmortagne> sauthieg: you'r welcome ;) 15:22  but it seems i just don't have enough java script skills and woudl need to read up on thta 15:22  that 15:22  i coudlnt figure how where exactly in the code the text backgroud color is changed 15:23  has quit 15:23  there is aparaently more than one way to do that 15:23  some related to adding additional xhtml tags, others, setting attributes via DOM 15:24  anyway, i will need more time on that (which i currently don't have) 15:24  so i will try to see what it takes to integrated gliffy instead 15:25  Dan18: if you don't get answers here feel free to post on the list 15:25  (this gives people more time to respond to you) 15:25  (note that a lot of xwiki devs are in a seminar right now so the answers might be slow) 15:26  what seminar? 15:27  perhaps that something i should look into also :-) 15:28  that's a seminar organized by XWiki SAS (http://xwiki.com) 15:31  hmm, interesting ... 15:31   i didnt know that there is a company associated with xwiki 15:33  has quit 15:35  thats interesting 15:41  just noticed that there is also a free cloud hosted xwiki for up to 2 users 15:42  thats great, makes it easier for me to share the wiki i am building, rather than bother with ddns etc. 15:47  hmm, there is also much research going on at xwiki 16:02  Dan18: yep :) 16:03  vmassol: are you part of the organization 16:03  yes 16:04  can i pm you for a question 16:04  sure 16:04  has joined #xwiki 16:07  has quit 16:20  has joined #xwiki 16:29  has quit 16:34  has quit 16:49  has joined #xwiki 17:14  has quit 17:14  has 20:08  has left #xwiki 21:34  has joined #xwiki 22:21  has quit 22:40  has joined #xwiki 22:41  Hi 22:41 <@cjdelisle> howdy 22:41  perhaps a quick question 22:42  whats wrong with the following syntax 22:42   [[image:http://www.gliffy.com/pubdoc/2803534/L.png]] 22:42  all i am getting is a question mark 22:42  not sure why, pasting the URL into a bowser works fine 22:43  generated the image macro using insert external image on an xwiki in the cloud 22:44 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HImages 22:44 <@cjdelisle> should be the last one 22:45  you mean without square backets 22:45 <@cjdelisle> I think that's it. 22:45  hmm, ok, let me try 22:47  didnt work unfortunatelt 22:47  t 22:47  y 22:47  just a second 22:48  nope 22:48 <@cjdelisle> are you using xwiki syntax 2.0? 22:48  ok, one squaere bracket 22:48  did the trick 22:49  but its weird 22:50  i have a dangling "[" opening bracket 22:50  is the square bracket reserved for syntax 22:50  i am using it in the text before 22:51 <@cjdelisle> no 22:51 <@cjdelisle> it's not 22:51 <@cjdelisle> that's as long as you are using syntax 2.0 22:51  yes, its 2.0 per default 22:52 <@cjdelisle> is the image: on it's own line? 22:52  now it stopped working again, not sure why 22:52  yes 22:52  own line 22:53  has joined #xwiki 22:54 <@cjdelisle> maybe there's an open macro or something confusing the parser, I can't really be much help without seeing it in context, I know that what you see usually works 22:55  ok, this doesnt make sense. I created a new page, inserted one image only in the whole page, using the insert image, and it doesnt work 22:56  is it possible that the png format has problems 22:56  that is the png extension 22:56 <@cjdelisle> xwiki doesn't care what the format is, it just creates an tag and lets your browser deal with it 22:56  right 22:57  http://water.cloud.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Water/ImageTrial 22:58 <@cjdelisle> nice background. can I have a password? 22:58  oh, i guess its not public 22:58  password 22:58  Admin 23:00 <@cjdelisle> hrm, this channel is logged, I can remove that passwd but it woul dbe safer for you to change it soon. 23:00  ok, please remove it, 23:01  thought it wasnt such a good idea putting it here, just after pressing enter 23:01 <@cjdelisle> I just edited the page so it's image: and it shows up fine for me 23:01  hmm 23:01 <@cjdelisle> heh I should have thought about that.. 23:02  so this is possibly a local problem 23:02 <@cjdelisle> what browser are you using? 23:02  safari 23:02  let me try firefox 23:03  hmm a safari problem ... 23:04  changed the password 23:04  but if you can remove it frmo the log, this would be great. 23:05  has left #xwiki 23:05  firefox also works great on my local installation -- 23:05  well, i better stay away from safari for xwiki 23:05 <@cjdelisle> I removed it from the log, it's still buried in the history of the log which I dare not touch for fear of causing the database to explode. 23:06 <@cjdelisle> wikis... 23:06  as long as its not public its fine 23:06 <@cjdelisle> it's possible to extract but it's certinly not going to end up on google 23:07  ok, i am glad we pin pointed the browser issue 23:07  perhaps something for the compatibility to do list 23:07  :-) 23:09 <@cjdelisle> Yea, it would make sense to bring it up on the list, over there some rendering experts can take a look at it and see if it's really an issue. 23:09 <@cjdelisle> Perhaps open that one page up to the public so it will be easier to diagnose. 23:10 <@cjdelisle> I am surprised that it's an issue since we have a number of devs who use apple computers. 23:15  not sure how to open it to the public 23:19 <@cjdelisle> If you want, I can give it a shot 23:19 <@cjdelisle> You should be able to do it via permissions objects in that document if the entire wiki is not closed. 23:23  how do i access the persmission object on taht page 23:23  has quit 23:23  (always eager to learn) 23:24 <@cjdelisle> Are you set as an "advanced user"? 23:24 <@cjdelisle> oh I know the answer and it's no 23:24 <@cjdelisle> so go to the upper right where it says "Admin" and click on your profile 23:25 <@cjdelisle> then once you're looking at your profile, click edit, (upper left) 23:26 <@cjdelisle> then once you're editing your profile, there are 3 tabs on the lower left, I forgot which one it is but when you click on one of them, it will give you the option to decide if you want to be a simple user or an advanced user. 23:27  ok 23:27 <@cjdelisle> are you an advanced user yet? 23:28 <@cjdelisle> according to the setting at least ;) 23:30   hmm, its actually set to advanced 23:30  brb 23:31 <@cjdelisle> ok let me know when you're back 23:31  ok, back 23:32 <@cjdelisle> ok, I thought you were set as simple user because I have noscript blocking javascript so I didn't see the dropdown menu 23:32 <@cjdelisle> head back to the page where you were 23:32 <@cjdelisle> with the picture 23:32 <@cjdelisle> then upper left, mouseover [edit] 23:33 <@cjdelisle> in the dropdown menu one option should be "rights" 23:35  ok 23:36  i guess you mean to set the acccess rights over the image trial page i created 23:37 <@cjdelisle> yup 23:38 <@cjdelisle> then there's a radio bubble for "groups" or "users", you want to select "users" 23:38  ok, so i make xwikallgroup read access 23:38  view access 23:38 <@cjdelisle> no, allgroup is only users who are registered. 23:38 <@cjdelisle> then you should see a user which represents unregistered users 23:38 <@cjdelisle> all guests are represented by one user 23:40  there is only an admin user 23:40  perhaps because i havent invited anyone yet 23:40 <@cjdelisle> hmm 23:40 <@cjdelisle> there should be an "unregistered" user 23:41  nope only Admin 23:41  i guess i cant really add an unregistered user 23:41  i think i know why, but its just a guess 23:41  i am using the free trial version 23:42  perhaps thats one of the restrictions there 23:42  only invited users 23:42  let me check my own installation 23:42 <@cjdelisle> perhaps, or it's for your own good to prevent attacks 23:42 <@cjdelisle> I could see that happening 23:43  also my own installation doesnt have an unregistered user 23:43  perhaps this kind of user was removed at some point in time as a matter of policy 23:44 <@cjdelisle> hrm 23:45  i could try to add such a user and see what happens :-) 23:45 <@cjdelisle> you don't see "Unregistered Users" listed when you click the "users" bubble? 23:45  i now also looked in the wiki administration section 23:45  under users 23:45  and there is only an admin 23:46  let me change the password back 23:46 <@cjdelisle> heh 23:46  so you can have a look 23:46 <@cjdelisle> ok 23:46  ok, you can log in now 23:47  http://water.cloud.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ 23:49 <@cjdelisle> ahh I see, limit to the number of users you can invite, that explains why guests are blocked. 23:50 <@cjdelisle> oh well, if you just explain it carefully, perhaps put an html dump into a pastebin, it should be enough. 23:51  whats a pastebin 23:51  or rather where is it 23:52 <@cjdelisle> there's a popular one at pastebin.com 23:52 <@cjdelisle> just free text hosting without having to sign up 23:53  ok 23:53  thanks 23:54 <@cjdelisle> sure thing 23:58  btw, do you know if xwiki is being used to gather requirements 23:58  i.e. a requirements gathering app with forms and the like
